There are several different ways to turn text into speech, depending on the software or device you're using. Here are some methods for various devices and platforms:

1. Google Text-to-Speech (Android):
- Go to Settings > Accessibility > Text-to-speech output.
- Select Google Text-to-speech as your preferred engine.
- Adjust other settings, such as Speech rate and Pitch, as desired.
- If an app specifically supports Google's text-to-speech feature, look for a "Read Aloud" button within the app.

2. Apple iOS (iPhone/iPad):
- Go to Settings > Accessibility > Spoken Content > Speak Selection or Speak Screen
- Turn on Speak Selection or Speak Screen depending on your needs.
  - With Speak Selection enabled, select the text that you want to convert into speech; this will cause a new menu option labeled 'Speak' to appear above it.
  - Speak Screen is best used with single-page content like articles and notes; once toggled from Control Center, it reads everything visible in order without needing users' manual navigation

3. Windows Operating System:
Microsoft provides built-in options on Windows OS called Narrator which can read out loud any available content but they also work well with Microsoft Edge browser offering immersive reading experience: -*-
   * Press Start Button & type "Narrator." Click it when found +:+|;
